Entries.default: You take a rubbing of the disc in its completed form. Judging by your surroundings, this coordinate system has gone untouched for millennia. Your findings may be of interest to someone.
[Study the engravings, look for a pattern.]
You can vaguely see how different points of the engraving seem to match up, forming a coherent shape in spite of being situated on opposing sides of the carving.
Now that the inner and outer wheels have been properly aligned, the disc once again resembles its intended function - a chart built around some antiquated measure of the islands.
[Destroy the disc.]
You find a heavy rock and hoist it above the disc. Smashing the rotational mechanism would guarantee that the navigational secret remains yours alone.
You find a heavy rock and hoist it above the disc. Smashing the rotational mechanism would guarantee that the navigational secret remains yours alone.
"I suppose that's one solution." Aloth sighs.
"I never liked that map." Edér frowns.
"Did an ancient golden map kill your papa or something?" Maia turns to you and furrows her brow.

"An extreme measure, but cunning."

Pallegina's golden eyes scrutinize you.

"Eh, cap, I be appreciating the value of a secret much as the next furry blue seaman, but maybe there be some wisdom in leaving this in case we be needing it again later?"

Serafen frowns at the hoisted stone and scratches the back of his head.
"No!" Tekēhu cries out and places his body between you and the disc.
[Destroy the disc.]
[Leave.]
You bring the rock down, splitting a mighty crack down the stonework. Something inside slips free and tumbles down a great distance.
Your next blow falls harder still. The ancient disc crumbles, collapsing under its weight and rendering the rotational mechanism useless.
The navigational chart is neither functional nor recognizable in its current state. Its secrets are safe.
A whimper rises from Tekēhu. He covers his mouth to stifle it.
The navigational chart has been destroyed. What once resembled a configuration of islands is now a meaningless intersection of vague, haphazard symbols.
[Attempt to decipher the disc with the golden wheel you possess.]
[Attempt to decipher the disc with the golden wheel you possess.]
You hold the outer ring up to the control panel, but it still requires the inner ring to make the mechanism function.
You hold the inner ring up to the control panel, but it does not align with any symbol in a way that makes sense. An outer ring that connects the axis to the greater disc is needed as well.

The emerging image is not exactly a map, but an index of islands and coordinates organized in relation to each other. You recognize several of the cited locations as containing nothing but open water. Charting a path by this obsolete system now would be impossible. 

The word 'Ukaizo' stands out from the other named islands.
Faster than you can react, noxious gas billows from a hairline fracture in the metal - burning your eyes and causing you to reel back in pain.
One by one, the recessed panels each click out of their settings. Evidently the trapped disc has reset itself, all but daring you to make another attempt.
[Take another rubbing of the navigational chart.]
You take another careful rubbing, hopeful that this one will survive longer than the last.
[Leave the disc intact and step away.]

Manipulating the control panel has rotated the rings of the massive, inner disc into a new configuration - one that lines up with neat precision. 

The engravings intersect in a manner that forms the shape of the Deadfire.

This massive, golden disc is covered with intricate engravings and inscriptions. You are able to pick out symbols representing plants, wildlife, and boats, but there's no discernible order or meaning to their configuration.
[Read the main inscription.]
[Leave.]
"What can I do for you?"

To all wayward kin, far from family shores.
Let this chart point the way home,
That your tribe may welcome you open-armed.
Engravings remember what the dead forget.
Take comfort in this sanctuary, read its teachings,
And let knowledge guide the hand that turns the wheels.
The rings you possess could easily be set around the inner axis of the control panel.

A circular depression stands out from the rest of the disc. 

The stone ring in your possession looks as if it could fit, but not without the other missing part.
A circular depression in the disc resembles what would be some sort of control mechanism, but its pieces are missing.

A circular depression stands out from the rest of the disc. 

The stone ring in your possession looks as if it could fit, but not without the other missing part.
[Slide the golden wheels onto the control panel.]
The rings settle into place, fitting neatly around their central axis. The outer ring is inscribed with passages in the Huana runic language.
A set of dots on the inscribed panels of the outer ring suggest that it should be rotated in a sequence, starting from one and ending in four.
[Rotate the wheel into the first configuration.]
[Leave.]
The rings which you installed around the axis of the control panel look as if they can be rotated to align in a specific formation.
Since you solved the riddle of the golden disc, the significance of the navigational chart is apparent.
The first inscription reads: Though their roots grow from Rikuhu's lightless bowels, their yield is a welcome reprieve. The inner ring can be turned to match a symbol to the inscription.
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of Ukaizo.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of luminous adra.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of koīki fruit.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of watershaping.]
You spin the wheels until the inscription aligns with the symbol of luminous adra.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Go back, reconsider.]

You press your weight on the panel. Deep inside the disc, you hear the rotation of heavy parts. 

The gold rings spring back up, ready to be spun again.
The next inscription reads: Our covenant to safeguard. Those petrified limbs are the health and safety of the Deadfire.
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of luminous adra.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of Ukaizo.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of koīki fruit.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of watershaping.]
You turn the wheels until the inscription matches up with the symbol of Ukaizo.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
You turn the wheel until the passage aligns with the symbol of koīki fruit.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
You turn the wheel, lining up the symbol of watershaping with the inscription.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
You turn the wheel back to its previous position and consider your options.
You spin the wheels until the inscription aligns with the symbol of luminous adra.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Go back, reconsider.]
You turn the wheels until the inscription matches up with the symbol of Ukaizo.
You turn the wheel until the passage aligns with the symbol of koīki fruit.
You turn the wheel, lining up the symbol of watershaping with the inscription.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Press down on the metalwork.]
The wheels settle into place with some resistance, likely owing to age and neglect. Beneath the disc, the groaning of gears sounds once more.
The next inscription reads: Ngati gifted her chosen people with dominion over her dark and turbulent kingdom.
You turn the wheel back to its previous position and consider your options.
[Go back, start from the beginning.]
[Leave.]
You undo your work and restore the wheel to its original position.
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of luminous adra.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of Ukaizo.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of koīki fruit.]
[Turn the wheel to align the inscription with the symbol of watershaping.]
You spin the wheels until the inscription aligns with the symbol of luminous adra.
You turn the wheels until the inscription matches up with the symbol of Ukaizo.
You turn the wheel until the passage aligns with the symbol of koīki fruit.
You turn the wheel, lining up the symbol of watershaping with the inscription.
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Go back, reconsider.]
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Press down on the metalwork.]
[Press down on the metalwork.]
You turn the wheel back to its previous position and consider your options.
A cacophonous grinding sound builds from somewhere deep beneath the disc. Whether this indicates a favorable outcome or not remains to be seen.
The final inscription reads: Our origin, our destination, our home. Wherever we go, she is the horizon.
[Turn the wheel to match the symbol of luminous adra and press the panel.]
[Turn the wheel to match the symbol of Ukaizo and press the panel.]
[Turn the wheel to match the symbol of koīki fruit and press the panel.]
[Turn the wheel to match the symbol of watershaping and press the panel.]

It takes an extra hard push, but the rings settle into place.

A long silence follows, in which you are forced to wonder whether or not you input the correct combination, and what consequences might follow either way.
The golden disc faces the sky, motionless and silent.
You note that the vacant depression in the control panel matches the engraved rings you found in the ruins.
Now that both of the missing pieces have been restored to the control panel, the inner rings can be rotated into different configurations.
The way the control panel sits atop the disc suggests that you could push this configuration down.
The way the control panel sits atop the disc suggests that you could push this configuration down.
The way the control panel sits atop the disc suggests that you could push this configuration down.
The way the control panel sits atop the disc suggests that you could push this configuration down.
As you step away from the disc, the clicking of parts grows in volume under the stone platform. The wheels slowly pop out of position and rotate to their original alignment.
A depression in the ring resembles a control panel, which could be used to manipulate the moving parts of the disc, though it is missing something.
Something about the island catches your attention. The runes surrounding it are particularly elaborate, and every measurement uses it as a point of origin.
"After all that this artifact has endured, do not let our coming be its death sentence."
"This knowledge is dangerous in the wrong hands."
"I'll think it over."
"This is all I ask." Nodding, Tekēhu exhales and stands down.
"And the right hands are the ones bent on destroying art, ekera?" Tekēhu gives you a look of utter bewilderment.
"You know my heart on this matter... captain." Tekēhu turns away and covers his mouth, unable or unwilling to watch.
"Say goodbye to the pretty chart."
"Heartless..." Tekēhu trails off, shaking his head.
Four symbols decorate the inner wheel. They show pillars of luminous adra, the native koīki fruit, a depiction of the Huana watershaping art, and a lovingly-engraved island.
The way these inscriptions align suggests a relationship between the two.
It's Ukaizo.
"Ekera, are we both seeing this?" Tekēhu brings a shaking hand up to wipe his mouth.

Whether or not this treasure should be available to just anyone who happens by is another matter.

The gold rings are resolutely locked in place.
